page.title: 06MR. WILDE'S HOUSE HURSLEY
page.content: Mr.Wilde's house in 42, The Main Road is Hursley.It is the oldest house in the village and is completely {Tudor,built 550 years ago on gravel. Two occupants who previously lived there were called Dallbridge. One other old lady lived on her own. Mr.Wild divided one upstairs room in half,so he could add a bathroom because originaly there wasn't one at all. Downstairs there are 2 rooms a tiny kitchen and living room.The fire place in the main room is very large and on the side of it there was a cabinet, where he could store salt,paper and other spices.Behind the fire there was an iron board with an animal carved in for decoration,and protection in the fire place for the walls.Mr.Wild had a very old cooking pot,called a {"Roasting Jack". }
